channel.title: [PI] Need Help [PI]
channel.description: Hey, Can someone help me with making a new home in my server?

item.title: [PI] Need Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

[quote="$Nathan"]Thanks forgot about that part :3.[/quote] No problem.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @_Nathan1 $Nathan
item.description:
@_Nathan1 wrote:

[quote=“belhelmiel, post:5, topic:402118”][quote author=$Nathan link=topic=499171.msg3650351#msg3650351 date=1309689918]
Don’t just post its so easy… Explain to him how to do it.
Data>Cfg>spawn-config.cfg
Move the npc’s to the place where you want them to be put (the coords)
Something like this:

spawn = 519	3098	3499	0	0	0	0	0	Skills Shop

519 = Npc code.
3098 = X coord
3499 = Y coord
Thats for moving the npc’s around.
Config.java is for where you change where you die and where you start.
Rsinterface.java (Client sided) Is where you change the coords when you home teleport.
Figure the rest out yourself.
[/quote]
He’s right you should figure the rest out yourself. Besides one thing. If you want to add objects to your home you need to go in ObjectManager.java (go in your server folder and press cntrl and f at the same time to search for this) then open it and press cntrl and f at the same time to search for public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) { Then under that there are custom spawns for objects.

		c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(ID, X, Y, 1, 10);

Put the object ID in the ID part and X and Y are the location of the object. Leave the 1, 10 alone. Good luck with your new server :3![/quote]Thanks forgot about that part :3.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

[quote="$Nathan, post:4, topic:402118"]Don’t just post its so easy… Explain to him how to do it.
Data>Cfg>spawn-config.cfg
Move the npc’s to the place where you want them to be put (the coords)
Something like this:

spawn = 519	3098	3499	0	0	0	0	0	Skills Shop

519 = Npc code.
3098 = X coord
3499 = Y coord
Thats for moving the npc’s around.
Config.java is for where you change where you die and where you start.
Rsinterface.java (Client sided) Is where you change the coords when you home teleport.
Figure the rest out yourself.[/quote]
He’s right you should figure the rest out yourself. Besides one thing. If you want to add objects to your home you need to go in ObjectManager.java (go in your server folder and press cntrl and f at the same time to search for this) then open it and press cntrl and f at the same time to search for public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) { Then under that there are custom spawns for objects.

		c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(ID, X, Y, 1, 10);

Put the object ID in the ID part and X and Y are the location of the object. Leave the 1, 10 alone. Good luck with your new server :3!

Read full topic
